intro: Murdannia semiteres, commonly known as the narrow-leaved murdannia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Commelinaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers arranged in spike-like inflorescences. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in wetland or marshy habitats. Murdannia semiteres is typically herbaceous and may be either annual or perennial depending on the climate.
